question: 丁寧
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>street</kanji> <kanji>rather</kanji> than a not-street. That's what I'm offering you to walk on. It's much nicer this way. I am being <vocabulary>polite</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>courteous</vocabulary> by offering you this street.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for <ja>丁</ja> is an unexpected one. It's <ja>てい</ja> instead of <ja>ちょう</ja>, so think about how the street is lined with <reading>ta</reading>ter (<ja>てい</ja>) tots, and how you can eat from them as you walk along on your trek. How <vocabulary>polite</vocabulary> of someone to leave them there for you!
